isis.stitle: 5 SPEED AND 6 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON SERIES - INSTALL - INPUT SHAFT

note.para: For the FS-5205 model, use a high quality grease on the fourteen (14) needle bearings installed in the main drive gear bearing pocket.
Do not heat the input shaft bearing above 275°F (136°C). If possible, use a heat lamp as the source.
On stem type bearing caps, the oil seal and bearing race must be installed from the rear.
The front and rear bearing covers are marked for proper installation.

step1.para: If the input shaft is disassembled, install a new input shaft bearing using a sleeve type bearing driver or heat lamp ( Figure 174).

figure.caption: Figure 174. Install New Input Shaft Bearing

step1.para: For the FS-5205 model, if removed, install the fourteen (14) lubricated roller bearings in the main drive gear bearing pocket. Install the retention ring and the bearing retention snap ring ( Figure 175).

figure.caption: Figure 175. Install Retention Ring and Bearing Retention Snap Ring

step1.para: Install the input shaft in the case by aligning the main drive clutching teeth ( Figure 176).

figure.caption: Figure 176. Install Input Shaft in Case

step1.para: Coat the input shaft bearing cover oil seal outer diameter with Loctite 242 or equivalent.
Install the oil seal with a flanged driver.
Install the input shaft bearing race ( Figure 177).

figure.caption: Figure 177. Install Input Shaft Bearing Race

step1.para: Position a new gasket on the front bearing mounting surface ( Figure 178).

figure.caption: Figure 178. Position New Gasket on Front Bearing Mounting Surface, Position Front Bearing Cover Over Gasket, and Install Retaining Bolts

step1.para: Position the front bearing cover over the gasket ( Figure 178).
Apply Loctite 242 or equivalent to the retaining bolts, if not precoated ( Figure 178).
Install retaining bolts and tighten to 15 to 25 ft-lbs. (20 to 34 N• m) ( Figure 178).
